item.title: Transnet 的主要工会拒绝接受竞争对手达成的工资协议
item.description: 南非全国运输联合工会（UNTU）周四表示，它拒绝了国有物流集团 Transnet 提出的最终工资方案，该方案是由一个较小的工会签署的。【原文：South Africa's United National Transport Union (UNTU) said on Thursday it rejected a final wage offer tabled by state-owned logistics group Transnet, which was signed by a smaller union.】

item.title: 特朗普表示，如果加拿大和欧盟对美国造成 "经济损害"，可能会对其征收更大规模的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，如果欧盟和加拿大联手 "对美国造成经济损害"，可能会对它们征收更大规模的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that larger tariffs could be placed on the European Union and Canada if they both work together "to do economic harm to the USA."】

item.title: 英国是否正处于另一桩数十亿英镑消费金融丑闻的风口浪尖？
item.description: 英国最高法院将于周二听取推翻一项判决的辩论，该判决可能会使英国金融业损失数十亿英镑的新法律费用和潜在的客户赔偿。【原文：The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom will on Tuesday hear arguments to overturn a judgment that could cost Britain's financial industry billions of pounds in fresh legal costs and potential customer compensation.】

item.title: 美国关税破坏盈利前景，汽车类股下滑
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在美国汽车行业设置关税墙后，对全球贸易受阻和汽车行业利润受挫的担忧导致汽车制造商股价暴跌，并推动周四市场普遍走弱。【原文：Worries about throttled global trade and a hit to auto industry profits sent shares of car makers tumbling and drove markets broadly weaker on Thursday after President Donald Trump put a wall of tariffs around the U.S. auto sector.】

item.title: 报告称，在 2024 年的所有电子杂货订单中，印度的快速商务部门占了三分之二
item.description: 咨询公司贝恩（Bain）和电子商务巨头 Flipkart 的一份报告显示，去年印度的快速商务部门占所有电子杂货订单的三分之二以上，从 2022 年起，其总市场份额将增长约五倍，达到 60 亿至 70 亿美元。【原文：India's quick commerce sector accounted for over two-thirds of all e-grocery orders last year, with its total market share growing about five times to $6-7 billion from 2022, a report by consultancy firm Bain and e-commerce giant Flipkart showed.】

item.title: 早间竞标：达斯汽车陷入关税漩涡
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 台湾计划以进口能源和削减关税应对特朗普关税
item.description: 台湾政府官员周四表示，台湾正在考虑对美国可能征收的新关税采取各种应对措施，包括增加能源进口和降低岛内关税，以平衡双边贸易。【原文：Taiwan is considering a variety of responses to potential new tariffs from the United States including increasing energy imports and reducing the island's own tariffs to balance bilateral trade, government officials said on Thursday.】

item.title: 韩国计划对美国汽车关税采取紧急应对措施
item.description: 韩国工业部长表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布的汽车进口关税生效后，韩国汽车行业预计将面临 "相当大的困难"，政府计划在四月前采取紧急应对措施。【原文：South Korea's auto sector is expected to face "considerable difficulties" when U.S. import tariffs on cars announced by President Donald Trump take effect and the government plans an emergency response by April, the industry minister said.】

item.title: JLR 母公司塔塔汽车和特斯拉的印度供应商因美国汽车关税计划而打滑
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对所有进口汽车和汽车零部件征收 25% 关税的计划后，印度塔塔汽车公司（Tata Motors）和为特斯拉（Tesla）等公司供货的印度汽车零部件制造商周四股价下跌。【原文：India's Tata Motors and the country's auto parts makers that supply Tesla , among others, dropped on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump announced plans for 25% tariffs on all imported cars and auto parts.】

item.title: BCG 报告称绿色航空燃料生产可能无法实现 2030 年目标
item.description: 波士顿咨询公司（BCG）在周四发布的一份报告中指出，可持续航空燃料（SAF）行业的产量增长不够快，未能实现2030年的目标。【原文：The sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) industry is falling short of its 2030 targets with production not ramping up quickly enough, Boston Consulting Group (BCG) found in a report published on Thursday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，富士康计划在日本举办电动车活动以吸引制造商
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的消息人士称，富士康将于 4 月 9 日在日本召开研讨会，阐述其电动汽车战略，因为富士康在赢得三菱汽车公司的交易后，正在向更多的日本汽车制造商示好。【原文：Foxconn is set to hold a seminar in Japan on April 9 to lay out its strategy on electric vehicles, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said, as it courts more Japanese automakers after winning a deal from Mitsubishi Motors.】

item.title: 巴西总统卢拉警告特朗普关税带来通胀风险，誓言就钢铁问题向世贸组织提出挑战
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）有可能通过额外关税损害美国经济，并誓言就对巴西钢铁征收贸易税一事向世界贸易组织（WTO）提出申诉。【原文：Brazil's President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said U.S. President Donald Trump risked damaging the U.S. economy with additional tariffs and vowed to lodge a complaint with the World Trade Organization (WTO) over a trade levy on Brazilian steel.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国要求国有企业停止与李嘉诚关联企业的交易
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周四援引知情人士的话报道称，在香港亿万富翁李嘉诚及其家族计划将巴拿马的两个港口出售给贝莱德（BlackRock）牵头的财团后，中国已指示国有企业暂停与李嘉诚及其家族相关企业的新交易。【原文：China has instructed state-owned firms to pause new deals with businesses linked to Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing and his family after his plan to sell two ports in Panama to a BlackRock-led consortium, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: SK 海力士称部分客户在美国加征关税前提前下单
item.description: 全球第二大内存芯片制造商韩国 SK 海力士公司周四表示，一些客户已经提前下单，为美国新关税做准备。【原文：South Korea's SK Hynix , the world's second-largest memory chip maker, said on Thursday that some customers have brought forward orders in preparation for new U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 马斯克称汽车关税对特斯拉影响 "重大
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周三表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的汽车关税对特斯拉的影响是 "重大的"。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Wednesday that the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's auto tariffs on Tesla is "significant."】

item.title: Robinhood 将为零售投资者带来财富管理和私人银行业务
item.description: Robinhood 正在为投资组合规模不大的投资者推出财富管理和私人银行服务，因为该交易平台希望对用户的理财习惯产生更大的影响。【原文：Robinhood is rolling out wealth management and private banking services for investors with modest portfolios, as the trading platform looks to have a bigger influence on its users' financial habits.】

item.title: JSR 新任首席执行官表示将专注于财务，放弃行业并购野心
item.description: 日本芯片材料制造商 JSR 新任首席执行官计划重点恢复公司的经营业绩，而不再像以前那样雄心勃勃地推动行业整合。【原文：The incoming CEO of Japanese chip materials maker JSR plans to focus on restoring the company's business performance, shifting away from previous ambitions to drive consolidation in the sector.】

item.title: 石油因供应风险收紧而上涨；对特朗普征收汽车关税的影响看法不一
item.description: 美国威胁对委内瑞拉石油买家征收关税后，市场担心全球供应趋紧，油价周四小幅走高，同时市场参与者还在努力应对唐纳德-特朗普最新宣布的汽车行业关税的影响。【原文：Oil prices nudged higher on Thursday on concerns about tighter global supply after the U.S. tariff threat on Venezuelan oil buyers, while market players also grappled with the impact of Donald Trump's latest announcement on auto-sector tariffs.】

item.title: 日本首相石破称，日本将 "所有选项都摆在桌面上 "应对美国汽车关税问题
item.description: 日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）周四表示，东京将把 "所有选择都摆在桌面上"，以应对华盛顿宣布对汽车进口征收 25% 关税一事。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Thursday Tokyo will put "all options on the table" in dealing with Washington's announcement to impose a 25% tariff on automobile imports.】

item.title: 特朗普对美国进口汽车征收 25% 新关税的内容有哪些？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三兑现了数周来对进口汽车征收新关税的威胁，称下周将对非美国制造的汽车征收 25% 的进口税。【原文：President Donald Trump on Wednesday followed through on weeks of threats for new tariffs on imported cars, saying a 25% import tax on vehicles not built in the U.S. would kick in next week.】

item.title: 特朗普对美国进口汽车征收 25% 关税，汽车业受到冲击
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三宣布将对进口到美国的所有汽车和外国制造的汽车零部件征收 25% 的关税，这令美国汽车制造商及其全球竞争对手感到震惊。【原文：U.S. automakers and their global rivals were rocked on Wednesday by President Donald Trump's announcement that he would impose 25% tariffs on all vehicles and foreign-made autoparts imported into the United States.】

item.title: 特朗普征收汽车关税，欧元创三周新低
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普从下周起对进口汽车和轻型卡车征收25%的关税之后，欧元兑美元汇率周四跌至三周低点，日元兑美元汇率持稳，因为迫在眉睫的全面贸易战使风险情绪变得暗淡。【原文：The euro weakened to a three-week low on Thursday and the yen was steady against the dollar after U.S. President Donald Trump slapped a 25% tariff on imported cars and light trucks starting next week as the looming all-out trade war dims risk sentiment.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理阿尔巴内斯称大选 "迫在眉睫"，政府急于通过减税法案
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞周四表示，他计划 "立即 "举行大选，因为他领导的中左翼政府正匆忙通过议会一项新的减税法案，以争取支持并赢回不满的选民。【原文：Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Thursday he planned to call an election "imminently" as his centre-left government rushed through the parliament a bill on fresh tax cuts in a bid to lift support and win back aggrieved voters.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布征收汽车关税，股市下滑，美元创三周新高
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对所有进口汽车征收新关税，加剧了全球贸易战，有可能助长通胀，美元攀升至三周高位。【原文：Asian shares skidded with Wall Street on Thursday while the dollar climbed to a three-week high after U.S. President Donald Trump announced new tariffs on all auto imports, ratcheting up a global trade war that risks fuelling inflation.】

item.title: 对特朗普汽车关税的反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三宣布从下周起对进口汽车和轻型卡车征收25%的关税，扩大了今年重新入主白宫后的征税范围，汽车行业专家预计此举将推高价格并阻碍生产。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday unveiled a 25% tariff on imported cars and light trucks starting next week, widening the upon regaining the White House this year in a move auto industry experts expect will drive up prices and stymie production.】

item.title: 美国消费者机构寻求撤销已胜诉的歧视案件
item.description: 美国最高消费者金融监管机构周三要求法院撤销该监管机构去年已经胜诉的一起执法案件，指控之前的机构官员滥用权力，试图强制执行贷款的多样性、公平性和包容性。【原文：The top U.S. consumer finance agency on Wednesday asked a court to undo an enforcement case which the watchdog had already won last year, accusing prior agency officials of abusing their power as they sought to enforce diversity, equity and inclusion in lending.】

item.title: 前英特尔首席执行官盖尔辛格加盟风险投资公司 Playground Global
item.description: 英特尔公司前首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）周三以普通合伙人的身份加入风险投资公司 Playground Global，同时还加入了一家致力于改进关键芯片制造工具的初创公司的董事会。【原文：Pat Gelsinger, the former CEO of Intel , on Wednesday joined venture capital firm Playground Global as a general partner and also joined the board of a startup working to improve a key chip manufacturing tool.】

item.title: 高盛将 2025 年底金价预期上调至每盎司 3,300 美元
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）周三将其2025年底的金价预期从每盎司3,100美元上调至3,300美元，理由是ETF资金流入强于预期，且央行需求持续。【原文：Goldman Sachs on Wednesday raised its end-2025 gold price forecast to $3,300 per ounce from $3,100, citing stronger-than-expected ETF inflows and sustained central bank demand.】

item.title: IMC 以 3500 万美元出售巴西肯德基股份，成立合资企业
item.description: 巴西餐饮特许经营运营商 IMC 周三表示，该公司已与肯塔基食品智利有限公司（Kentucky Foods Chile Limitada）签署了一项具有约束力的协议，就 IMC 在巴西经营肯德基餐厅事宜成立一家合资企业。【原文：Brazilian restaurant franchise operator IMC said on Wednesday it has signed a binding agreement to create a joint venture with Kentucky Foods Chile Limitada regarding IMC's operations of KFC restaurants in Brazil.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布征收汽车进口关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三晚些时候表示，美国将对所有非本国制造的汽车实际征收 25% 的关税，并补充说，对进口到美国的汽车和轻型卡车征收的新关税将是永久性的。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said late on Wednesday the United States will effectively charge a 25% tariff on all cars not made in the country and added that the new tariffs on cars and light trucks imported into the United States will be permanent.】
